basic_info.description: My name is Ethan Luxton. I come from an educational background in marketing and public relations. I pivoted very heavily after college into finance. Specifically retail banking and wealth management. Throughout my entire life, I have always found technology interesting, I built my first computer when I was 13, and programmed my first ‘Hello world’ that same year. Since then, I programmed on and off throughout high school and college, in various languages: C#, Java, C++, HTML, and Python to name a few. Recently, I decided that I wasn’t fully committed to a career in finance, so I decided to make the switch to software development. I knew it wasn’t going to be easy, but I have learned so much in the past months to build upon my previous experience. To include various web development tools and languages. My current goal is to help build the technologies that the world uses every day, from the operating systems we use to the front end of a website that serves millions. The thing that excites me the most about tech, is the future. We are in an era where there are so many new technologies and developments, it is really exciting to see all these amazing things come to life and I can't wait to see what comes in the future.

projects.title: Tarkine
projects.description: My first experience with creating a game within a web application. Tarkine is a puzzle and decision based story game that takes the player on a journey to safety after a terrible plane crash. The player must find items, solve puzzles, and make the correct decisions to escape the forest.

projects.title: Salmon Cookies
projects.description: This was an infamous project during my time at Code Fellows. It tested ability in DOM manipulation and randomized data.

projects.title: Can of Books
projects.description: This project intended to test my skills in creating a Express.js server that utilized Axios, dotEnv, Cors and MongoDB to pass information to a React-based frontend application. The front end is hosted on Netlify and the backend is hosted on Heroku

experience.company: Washington State Department of Natural Resources
experience.title: Education and Public Outreach Intern
More experience details on my LinkedIn /ethan-luxton
